strings.Value: "In your letter, you begged for help."
[Attack] "It's time for you to go to your final rest."

{n}The figure, clad in tattered scraps of clothes, slowly turns towards you and takes a few shuffling steps in your direction. From under the ragged pieces of cloth, once undoubtedly bright and rich, the face of a dead man, barely covered with flesh, stares back at you. His eye-sockets glow with a terrifying pale light.{/n} "I can't believe it! So, finally, someone fell for the letter? I admit, it was a weak plan, but I had so little time to invent it..."
"It seems I hear notes of uncertainty in your voice, brave adventurer — am I wrong? Yes, I am Farnirras the Pensive. Our acquaintance won't last long, but nevertheless I am happy to meet you!"
"One extremely annoying creature — one I'll have to get rid of… right after I deal with you."
"Such remarkable chattiness. Though wait, you've spent — how many years locked alone in a dark dungeon? I suppose that explains all the awkward attempts at wit and sarcasm."

"Of course I did. People tend to become less vigilant when someone is humbly begging their aid. They mistake the begging for weakness. Just think about it — how many would have come to the aid if I started my letter: "Dear sirs! The allmighty lich, locked in a magic prison, desperately wants to break free"?
"Oh, we'll definitely return to our fascinating conversation… after I kill you and raise you as an undead servant. You'll become my favorite zombie-slave."
"Trick with the letter! He steal your think-thoughts, {name}? Or worse something?" {n}Nok-Nok backs away slowly.{/n}
